headline: Ask HN: Non-technical considerations for Low-touch SaaS
description:
I'm thinking of launching a commercial library for handling specialized tasks in applications. Billing would be on a subscription basis (monthly/annually with discount), probably based on the number of instances/seats.

I have an engineering background, and some experience in running a business with mainly domestic customers.

What kind of complexity and overhead will I incur once I start selling globally? My hope was that I could delegate all the billing complexities (namely VAT) to a service like Stripe. But apparently they still require VAT registration in all countries where the software could be purchased.

In the beginning it would be just me, and I'd like to be able to focus fully on product development.

Any helpful inputs or pointers are much appreciated.
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 低接触SaaS的非技术性考虑
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 低接觸SaaS的非技術性考慮
description_zh-Hans:
我正在考虑推出一个商业库，用于处理应用程序中的专门任务。

我有工程背景，也有一些经营主要面向国内客户的业务的经验。

一旦我开始在全球范围内销售，会产生什么样的复杂性和开销？我的希望是，我可以把所有复杂的账单（即增值税）委托给Stripe这样的服务。但显然，他们仍然需要在所有可以购买该软件的国家注册增值税。

在开始时，只有我一个人，我希望能够完全专注于产品开发。
description_zh-Hant:
我正在考慮推出一個商業庫，用於處理應用程序中的專門任務。

我有工程背景，也有一些經營主要面向國內客戶的業務的經驗。

一旦我開始在全球範圍內銷售，會產生什麼樣的複雜性和開銷？我的希望是，我可以把所有複雜的賬單（即增值稅）委託給Stripe這樣的服務。但顯然，他們仍然需要在所有可以購買該軟件的國家註冊增值稅。

在開始時，只有我一個人，我希望能夠完全專注於產品開發。
